page.title: 11COUNTRY PARK
page.content: Yateley Country Park is Hampshire's largest common, a mere fragment of the heather moor it once was. It now covers 493 acres, entrusted to Hampshire C.C. The other 1200 acres of heathland are taken up by Blackbushe Airport and Forestry Commission plantation. The woodlands, the water areas, the gorse and heather provide a good territory for bird watchers and a wide variety of birds can be seen including the Dartford Warbler and Hobby.Careful conservation and education by a team of wardens ensures that both the common and rare plants, birds,fishes and insects are preserved. Badger setts have been here for over 150 years and deer can often be seen and several ponds provide a variety of wildlife and are used for coarse fishing.
